intro: Ceropegia wallichii, commonly known as the string of hearts, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Ceropegia wallichii is popular as a decorative indoor plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
